name: Principles relating to processing of personal data
description: Establishes fundamental principles: lawfulness, fairness, transparency, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality, accountability

name: Lawfulness of processing
description: Defines six legal bases for processing: consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, legitimate interests

name: Conditions for consent
description: Requirements for valid consent: demonstrable, clear and distinguishable presentation, easy withdrawal, conditional consent prohibition

name: Processing of special categories of personal data
description: Prohibitions and exceptions for sensitive data: racial/ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, health data, biometric data, genetic data, sexual orientation

name: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions
description: Restrictions on processing criminal conviction and offences data - only under official authority or Union/Member State law

name: Transparent information, communication and modalities
description: Requirements for transparent communication: concise, transparent, intelligible, easily accessible form using clear and plain language

name: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject
description: Mandatory disclosures when collecting data directly: controller identity, DPO contact, purposes, legal basis, recipients, retention periods, data subject rights

name: Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject
description: Additional disclosures for indirect collection: categories of personal data, source of data, plus all Art. 13 requirements

name: Responsibility of the controller
description: Controller accountability: implement appropriate technical and organisational measures, demonstrate compliance with GDPR principles

name: Data protection by design and by default
description: Mandatory implementation of data protection at design stage and in default settings, including pseudonymisation and data minimisation

name: Processor
description: Processor requirements: written contracts, sufficient guarantees, processing only on documented instructions, security obligations

name: Records of processing activities
description: Mandatory written records of all processing activities under controller or processor responsibility, including purposes, categories, recipients, transfers, retention

name: Security of processing
description: Appropriate technical and organisational security measures: pseudonymisation, encryption, confidentiality, integrity, availability, resilience, regular testing

name: Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority
description: Breach notification to authority: without undue delay, where feasible within 72 hours, describing nature, categories, consequences, and measures taken

name: Communication of a personal data breach to the data subject
description: Breach notification to individuals: required when breach likely to result in high risk to rights and freedoms, using clear and plain language

name: Data protection impact assessment
description: DPIA required for high-risk processing: systematic monitoring, large scale sensitive data, innovative technologies, profiling with legal effects
